change.title: Greenhouse Gas Reduction Targets Act

change.changenote: Section 1, definition of "carbon neutral" BEFORE amended by 2014-29-58, effective January 1, 2016 (BC Reg 247/2015 as amended by BC Reg 260/2015).

bcl:definition.bcl:text: carbon neutral, in relation to a public sector organization for a particular period, means that the public sector organization has complied with the obligations under section 6 [requirements for achieving carbon neutral status] to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: pursue actions to minimize the relevant greenhouse gas emissions for that period, and
net those greenhouse gas emissions to zero in accordance with that section;

change.changenote: Section 1, definition of "emission offset" BEFORE repealed by 2014-29-58, effective January 1, 2016 (BC Reg 247/2015 as amended by BC Reg 260/2015).

bcl:definition.bcl:text: emission offset means an emission offset, as established, approved or recognized under the regulations for the purpose of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: reducing greenhouse gas emissions, or
reducing atmospheric greenhouse gas concentrations through storage, sequestration or other means;

change.changenote: Section 1, definitions of "offset unit", "registry" and "retire" were added by 2014-29-58, effective January 1, 2016 (BC Reg 247/2015 as amended by BC Reg 260/2015).

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by 2020 and for each subsequent calendar year, BC greenhouse gas emissions will be at least 33% less than the level of those emissions in 2007;

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Progress reports on reducing BC greenhouse gas emissions
bcl:section.bcl:text: Beginning with a report on 2008 BC greenhouse gas emissions, and continuing with a report for every subsequent even-numbered calendar year, the minister must, as soon as reasonably practicable for each year, make public a report respecting

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a determination of the BC greenhouse gas emissions level for the relevant calendar year,
the progress that has been made toward achieving the targets under section 2,
the actions that have been taken to achieve that progress, and
the plans to continue that progress.

change.changenote: Part 1.1, section 4.1, was enacted by 2018-32-3, effective November 9, 2018 (BC Reg 235/2018).
Part 1.1, section 4.1, BEFORE repealed by 2019-43-4, effective November 28, 2019 (Royal Assent).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Reports on climate change risks and progress
bcl:section.bcl:text: Beginning with a report for the 2020 calendar year, and continuing with a report for every subsequent even-numbered calendar year, the minister must prepare and make public, as soon as reasonably practicable for each year, a report respecting

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a determination of the risks to BC that could reasonably be expected to result from a changing climate,
the progress that has been made toward reducing those risks,
the actions that have been taken to achieve that progress, and
the plans to continue that progress.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Provincial government must be carbon neutral for the 2008 and 2009 calendar years in relation to its PSO greenhouse gas emissions that are directly related to public officials travelling on public business for which the travel expenses are covered by the consolidated revenue fund.
In advance of the obligation under subsection (1), for the 2008 and 2009 calendar years, each public sector organization must pursue actions to minimize its PSO greenhouse gas emissions.

change.changenote: Section 6 (2) BEFORE repealed by 2014-29-59, effective January 1, 2016 (BC Reg 247/2015 as amended by BC Reg 260/2015).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In order to be carbon neutral in relation to the PSO greenhouse gas emissions referred to in section 5 (2) [emissions related to travel] for a calendar year, the Provincial government must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: pursue actions to minimize those PSO greenhouse gas emissions for the calendar year,
determine those PSO greenhouse gas emissions for that calendar year in accordance with the regulations, and
no later than the end of June in the following calendar year, apply emission offsets in accordance with the regulations to net those emissions to zero.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Carbon neutral action reports — Provincial government

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Beginning with a report for the 2008 calendar year, and continuing with a report for every subsequent calendar year, the minister must prepare, and make public no later than the end of June of the following calendar year, a carbon neutral action report in accordance with this section.
The carbon neutral action reports for 2010 and subsequent calendar years must include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the actions taken by the Provincial government in the relevant calendar year to minimize its PSO greenhouse gas emissions;
its plans to continue minimizing those emissions;
a determination of its PSO greenhouse gas emissions for the relevant calendar year;
a statement of the offset units retired on behalf of the Provincial government in relation to those emissions;
any other information required by regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Carbon neutral action reports — other public sector organizations

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Beginning with a report for the 2008 calendar year, and continuing with a report for every subsequent calendar year, each public sector organization, other than the Provincial government, must prepare, and make public no later than the end of June of the following calendar year, a carbon neutral action report in accordance with this section.
The carbon neutral action reports for 2010 and subsequent calendar years must include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the actions taken by the public sector organization in the relevant calendar year to minimize its PSO greenhouse gas emissions;
its plans to continue minimizing those emissions;
a determination of its PSO greenhouse gas emissions for the relevant calendar year;
a statement of the offset units retired on behalf of the public sector organization in relation to those emissions;
any other information required by regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Public sector organization authority in relation to emission offsets
bcl:section.bcl:text: Without limiting an authority provided under any other Act, but subject to the regulations,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: public sector organizations may, for the purposes of this Act or for other prescribed purposes, acquire, dispose of or otherwise deal with emission offsets, and
the Provincial government may act as agent for other public sector organizations in exercising their authority under paragraph (a).
